contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2012}} {{Infobox Weapon |name= Spearfish |image= |caption= |origin= |type= Heavyweight torpedo <!-- Type selection --> |is_ranged= |is_bladed= |is_explosive=yes |is_artillery= |is_vehicle= |is_missile=yes |is_UK=yes <!-- Service history --> |service=1992–present |used_by= |wars= <!-- Production history --> |designer= |design_date= |manufacturer=[[BAE Systems|BAE Systems Underwater Systems]] |unit_cost= |production_date=1988–2003 |number= |variants= <!-- General specifications --> |spec_label= |weight= 1,850 kg (4,075 lb) |length= 7 m (23 ft) |part_length= |width= |height= |diameter=533 mm (21 in) |crew= <!-- Ranged weapon specifications --> |cartridge= |caliber= |barrels= |action= |rate= |velocity= |range= |max_range= 54 km (30 nmi) at low speed<br/ >23 km (12.5 nmi) at high speed |feed= |sights= <!-- Explosive specifications --> |filling= [[aluminium|Aluminised]] [[Polymer-bonded explosive|PBX explosive]] |filling_weight=300 kg (660 lb) |detonation=Proximity or contact detonation |yield= <!-- Vehicle/missile specifications --> |armour= |primary_armament= |secondary_armament= |engine=[[Sundstrand Corporation|Sundstrand]] gas-turbine with [[pump-jet]] |engine_power= |pw_ratio= |transmission= |payload_capacity= |suspension= |clearance= |wingspan= |propellant= HAP / [[Otto fuel II]] |fuel_capacity= |vehicle_range= |ceiling= |altitude= |boost= |speed= {{convert|80|kn|km/h|abbr=on}} (1994 version on short range setting) |guidance=Wire-guided with autonomous active terminal homing [[sonar]] |steering= |accuracy= |launch_platform= |transport= }} The '''Spearfish torpedo''' (formally Naval Staff Target 7525) is the heavy [[torpedo]] used by the [[submarine]]s of the [[Royal Navy]]. It can be guided by [[wire guidance|wire]] or by [[acoustic homing|autonomous active or passive sonar]], and provides both [[anti-submarine warfare]] (ASW) and [[Anti-surface warfare|anti-surface ship warfare]] (ASuW) capability. It replaces the unreliable [[Tigerfish torpedo]], which was withdrawn in 2004; the significantly higher speed of the Spearfish, for which development started in the 1970s, before the [[breakup of the Soviet Union]], was intended to catch high-speed, deep-diving [[Soviet Navy|Soviet]] threats such as the {{sclass2|Alfa|submarine}}. ==Design== The torpedo is driven by a [[pump-jet]] coupled to a [[Hamilton Sundstrand]] 21TP04 [[gas turbine engine]] using [[Otto fuel II]] and hydroxyl ammonium perchlorate as oxidiser. A [[microprocessor]] enables the torpedo to make autonomous tactical decisions during the attack. It has a powerful blast warhead, triggered by either contact detonation (against a submarine hull) or an acoustic [[proximity fuze]] (for under-keel detonation against ships). ==Production== The production contract for the Spearfish Torpedo was placed with [[Marconi Company|GEC-Marconi]] Underwater Systems Ltd (now [[BAE Systems]]) in 1983, following a development programme lasting for several years. ==Deployment== Spearfish entered full production in 1988, with deliveries completed in 2003; the number ordered has not been revealed. Spearfish torpedoes are stored and serviced at [[Beith]] Ordnance Storage facility in [[North Ayrshire]]. ==See also== * [[Mark 48 torpedo]] * [[DM2A4|DM2A4 heavyweight torpedo]] * [[Fairey Spearfish]], an unrelated 1940s torpedo bomber aircraft * [[Yu-6 torpedo]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.royalnavy.mod.uk/operations-and-support/surface-fleet/weapon-systems/spearfish-torpedo/index.htm Spearfish Torpedo] {{Royal Navy torpedoes}} [[Category:Cold War weapons of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Torpedoes of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:BAE Systems weapons systems]] [[Category:General Electric Company plc]] [[Category:1992 introductions]]
